data.title: Gus Johnson's latest nickname for Marvin Harrison Jr. generates mixed reviews
data.meta_description: Gus Johnson dialed up another nickname for Ohio State's superstar receiver, but some fans were not appreciative.
data.text:
Gus Johnson is in Columbus on the call for the massive Penn State vs. Ohio State showdown. The popular FOX broadcaster is calling the game alongside Joel Klatt for the Network’s weekly “Big Noon Saturday” matchup.

Johnson is well-known for some of his iconic calls and on-the-spot nicknames for key players. He dropped another unique moniker in the first quarter of the Week 8 game, though it has drawn mixed reviews.

During Ohio State’s first drive of the game, Johnson referred to superstar wide receiver Marvin Harrison Jr. as “Maserati Marv.” It is the latest in a growing list of nicknames for the electric playmaker.

However, not every fan on social media loves Johnson’s latest nickname. Some pointed out it’s a great nickname while others are expressing frustration that Johnson continues to use it extensively in the first quarter.

Here is how the reaction has poured in to Saturday’s broadcast:
